      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }

          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;

          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));

          }

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

        @media (max-width: 840px) {

            min-height: 0;

            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;

    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;

  }

    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;

      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);

    }

    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>
      
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

          Comment 2<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146670#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      wfh@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/2196431582" title="wfh@chromium.org"><!---->wfh@chromium.org<!----></a>
      wfh@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->wfh@chromium.org<!----></span>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146670#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146670#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Nov 6, 2020, 10:36 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

        # Renderer Bug<span class="line"><!----># Renderer Bug<!----></span><br><br>## Details<span class="line"><!---->## Details<!----></span><br><br>When compiling large wasm code, chrome would serialize the compiled code as code cache and reuse it if the wasm resource is requested a second time. For now, WebAssembly caching is only implemented for the streaming API calls such as `compileStreaming`.<span class="line"><!---->When compiling large wasm code, chrome would serialize the compiled code as code cache and reuse it if the wasm resource is requested a second time. For now, WebAssembly caching is only implemented for the streaming API calls such as `compileStreaming`.<!----></span><br><br>However, the validation of wasm cache hit is insufficient. If attacker<span class="line"><!---->However, the validation of wasm cache hit is insufficient. If attacker<!----></span><br><br>1. Fetch a wasm resource (called *res_a*) from server without any cache control hint. and then<span class="line"><!---->1. Fetch a wasm resource (called *res_a*) from server without any cache control hint. and then<!----></span><br>2. Fetch a wasm resource with the same origin, but this time, the server will return a different resource file (called *res_b*) and tell chrome to cache it.<span class="line"><!---->2. Fetch a wasm resource with the same origin, but this time, the server will return a different resource file (called *res_b*) and tell chrome to cache it.<!----></span><br>3. Compile *res_a* , and chrome would reuse the code cache generated for *res_b* which results in type confusion.<span class="line"><!---->3. Compile *res_a* , and chrome would reuse the code cache generated for *res_b* which results in type confusion.<!----></span><br><br>## Exploitation<span class="line"><!---->## Exploitation<!----></span><br><br>Untagged WebAssembly global values are stored in a ArrayBuffer. The bounds check of accessing a global value is done in compile phase. As such, we can cause OOB access on partition heap by leveraging the type confusion bug and then achieves RCE.<span class="line"><!---->Untagged WebAssembly global values are stored in a ArrayBuffer. The bounds check of accessing a global value is done in compile phase. As such, we can cause OOB access on partition heap by leveraging the type confusion bug and then achieves RCE.<!----></span><br><br># Sandbox Escape<span class="line"><!----># Sandbox Escape<!----></span><br><br>## Details<span class="line"><!---->## Details<!----></span><br><br>|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<span class="line"><!---->|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<span class="line"><!---->int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<span class="line"><!---->  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host->GetFileSystemHost(); <-----<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host-&gt;GetFileSystemHost(); &lt;-----<!----></span><br>  open_flags_ = open_flags;<span class="line"><!---->  open_flags_ = open_flags;<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<span class="line"><!---->And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<span class="line"><!---->void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  found->second->SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<span class="line"><!---->  found-&gt;second-&gt;SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<!----></span><br>  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found->second); <--------<span class="line"><!---->  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found-&gt;second); &lt;--------<!----></span><br>  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<span class="line"><!---->  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<span class="line"><!---->This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_->GetFileSystemOperationRunner()->OpenFile(<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_-&gt;GetFileSystemOperationRunner()-&gt;OpenFile(<!----></span><br>      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<span class="line"><!---->      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>## Exploitation<span class="line"><!---->## Exploitation<!----></span><br><br>I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <span class="line"><!---->I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>    if (check_quota_)<span class="line"><!---->    if (check_quota_)<!----></span><br>      quota_file_system = file_system_host_->pp_resource();<span class="line"><!---->      quota_file_system = file_system_host_-&gt;pp_resource();<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<span class="line"><!---->After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<!----></span><br><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce<!----></a><br><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ppapi/host/ppapi_host.cc;l=262;drc=708fa822987d1b2146ce2659156a7713ac5e6810<a class="undefined"         I think the python webserver is a red herring, it's probably been included by accident. Here's how to make it work.<span class="line"><!---->I think the python webserver is a red herring, it's probably been included by accident. Here's how to make it work.<!----></span><br><br>1. Move chrome.zip from <span class="line"><!---->1. Move chrome.zip from <!----></span>#c3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c3"><!---->#c3<!----></a> into a redshell - <span class="line"><!----> into a redshell - <!----></span>https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hatrhi6V5_WogV7hIO2gSI5Uk8hHjdSAQeix4vTPt38/edit#<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hatrhi6V5_WogV7hIO2gSI5Uk8hHjdSAQeix4vTPt38/edit#"><!---->https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hatrhi6V5_WogV7hIO2gSI5Uk8hHjdSAQeix4vTPt38/edit#<!----></a><br>2. cd chrome/exp/ssl<span class="line"><!---->2. cd chrome/exp/ssl<!----></span><br>3. ln -s ../poc poc<span class="line"><!---->3. ln -s ../poc poc<!----></span><br>4. python3 server.py<span class="line"><!---->4. python3 server.py<!----></span><br>5. In Chrome visit <span class="line"><!---->5. Nothing happens - because the GET method in server.py is not wired up. It looks like the whole of server.py is nonsense/irrelevant to me.<span class="line"><!---->6. It looks like the whole of server.py is nonsense/irrelevant to me.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This bug requires manual review: We are only 0 days from stable.<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: We are only 0 days from stable.<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8.       </style>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <chops-button class="de-emphasized">
              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">
               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        <div class="container-outside" id="issue">
          <aside class="metadata-container">
            <mr-issue-metadata></mr-issue-metadata>
          </aside>

            <div class="container-issue-content">
              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-keystrokes></mr-keystrokes>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

          Note:<b>Note:</b>
          Clock icons indicate that users may not be available.
          Tooltips show the reason.

              Internals>Plugins>Pepper<a href="/p/chromium/issues/list?q=component:Internals>Plugins>Pepper" title="Internals>Plugins>Pepper = Pepper plugins">
              Internals&gt;Plugins&gt;Pepper<!----></a><br>
          
            
              Blink>JavaScript>WebAssembly<a href="/p/chromium/issues/list?q=component:Blink>JavaScript>WebAssembly" title="Blink>JavaScript>WebAssembly = V8 WebAssembly issues">
              Blink&gt;JavaScript&gt;WebAssembly<!----></a><br>

          Comment 2<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146670#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146670#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Nov 6, 2020, 10:36 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>

        # Renderer Bug<span class="line"><!----># Renderer Bug<!----></span><br><br>## Details<span class="line"><!---->## Details<!----></span><br><br>When compiling large wasm code, chrome would serialize the compiled code as code cache and reuse it if the wasm resource is requested a second time. For now, WebAssembly caching is only implemented for the streaming API calls such as `compileStreaming`.<span class="line"><!---->When compiling large wasm code, chrome would serialize the compiled code as code cache and reuse it if the wasm resource is requested a second time. For now, WebAssembly caching is only implemented for the streaming API calls such as `compileStreaming`.<!----></span><br><br>However, the validation of wasm cache hit is insufficient. If attacker<span class="line"><!---->However, the validation of wasm cache hit is insufficient. If attacker<!----></span><br><br>1. Fetch a wasm resource (called *res_a*) from server without any cache control hint. and then<span class="line"><!---->1. Fetch a wasm resource (called *res_a*) from server without any cache control hint. and then<!----></span><br>2. Fetch a wasm resource with the same origin, but this time, the server will return a different resource file (called *res_b*) and tell chrome to cache it.<span class="line"><!---->2. Fetch a wasm resource with the same origin, but this time, the server will return a different resource file (called *res_b*) and tell chrome to cache it.<!----></span><br>3. Compile *res_a* , and chrome would reuse the code cache generated for *res_b* which results in type confusion.<span class="line"><!---->3. Compile *res_a* , and chrome would reuse the code cache generated for *res_b* which results in type confusion.<!----></span><br><br>## Exploitation<span class="line"><!---->## Exploitation<!----></span><br><br>Untagged WebAssembly global values are stored in a ArrayBuffer. The bounds check of accessing a global value is done in compile phase. As such, we can cause OOB access on partition heap by leveraging the type confusion bug and then achieves RCE.<span class="line"><!---->Untagged WebAssembly global values are stored in a ArrayBuffer. The bounds check of accessing a global value is done in compile phase. As such, we can cause OOB access on partition heap by leveraging the type confusion bug and then achieves RCE.<!----></span><br><br># Sandbox Escape<span class="line"><!----># Sandbox Escape<!----></span><br><br>## Details<span class="line"><!---->## Details<!----></span><br><br>|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<span class="line"><!---->|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<span class="line"><!---->int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<span class="line"><!---->  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host->GetFileSystemHost(); <-----<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host-&gt;GetFileSystemHost(); &lt;-----<!----></span><br>  open_flags_ = open_flags;<span class="line"><!---->  open_flags_ = open_flags;<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<span class="line"><!---->And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<span class="line"><!---->void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  found->second->SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<span class="line"><!---->  found-&gt;second-&gt;SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<!----></span><br>  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found->second); <--------<span class="line"><!---->  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found-&gt;second); &lt;--------<!----></span><br>  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<span class="line"><!---->  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<span class="line"><!---->This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_->GetFileSystemOperationRunner()->OpenFile(<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_-&gt;GetFileSystemOperationRunner()-&gt;OpenFile(<!----></span><br>      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<span class="line"><!---->      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>## Exploitation<span class="line"><!---->## Exploitation<!----></span><br><br>I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <span class="line"><!---->I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>    if (check_quota_)<span class="line"><!---->    if (check_quota_)<!----></span><br>      quota_file_system = file_system_host_->pp_resource();<span class="line"><!---->      quota_file_system = file_system_host_-&gt;pp_resource();<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<span class="line"><!---->After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<!----></span><br><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce<!----></a><br><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ppapi/host/ppapi_host.cc;l=262;drc=708fa822987d1b2146ce2659156a7713ac5e6810<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ppapi/host/ppapi_host.cc;l=262;drc=708fa822987d1b2146ce2659156a7713ac5e6810"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ppapi/host/ppapi_host.cc;l=262;drc=708fa822987d1b2146ce2659156a7713ac5e6810<!----></a><br><br>[3] <span class="line"><!---->[3] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:base/memory/weak_ptr.h;l=247;drc=1066e389d45dd39f22f2daf582fc56948d5cc480<a class="undefined" target="_blank"       </div><br>
    
        
      
        Setting Pri-0 to match security severity Critical. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<span class="line"><!---->Setting Pri-0 to match security severity Critical. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

      <mr-description></mr-description>
      <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <!----></mr-issue-details>
              
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      <style>
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

        </table>
      </div>

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>
      
        <div class="container-outside" id="issue">
          <aside class="metadata-container">

        mr-issue-page {

          justify-content: flex-start;

        }

          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;

          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }

          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);

          min-width: 256px;

          width: 100%;
