        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

    Code<chops-toggle title="Code font"><!---->Code<!----></chops-toggle>

          Comment 2<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146670#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      wfh@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/2196431582" title="wfh@chromium.org"><!---->wfh@chromium.org<!----></a>
      wfh@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->wfh@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>

    <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Nov 6, 2020, 10:36 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146670#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Nov 6, 2020, 10:36 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146670#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Nov 6, 2020, 10:36 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        # Renderer Bug<span class="line"><!----># Renderer Bug<!----></span><br><br>## Details<span class="line"><!---->## Details<!----></span><br><br>When compiling large wasm code, chrome would serialize the compiled code as code cache and reuse it if the wasm resource is requested a second time. For now, WebAssembly caching is only implemented for the streaming API calls such as `compileStreaming`.<span class="line"><!---->When compiling large wasm code, chrome would serialize the compiled code as code cache and reuse it if the wasm resource is requested a second time. For now, WebAssembly caching is only implemented for the streaming API calls such as `compileStreaming`.<!----></span><br><br>However, the validation of wasm cache hit is insufficient. If attacker<span class="line"><!---->However, the validation of wasm cache hit is insufficient. If attacker<!----></span><br><br>1. Fetch a wasm resource (called *res_a*) from server without any cache control hint. and then<span class="line"><!---->1. Fetch a wasm resource (called *res_a*) from server without any cache control hint. and then<!----></span><br>2. Fetch a wasm resource with the same origin, but this time, the server will return a different resource file (called *res_b*) and tell chrome to cache it.<span class="line"><!---->2. Fetch a wasm resource with the same origin, but this time, the server will return a different resource file (called *res_b*) and tell chrome to cache it.<!----></span><br>3. Compile *res_a* , and chrome would reuse the code cache generated for *res_b* which results in type confusion.<span class="line"><!---->3. Compile *res_a* , and chrome would reuse the code cache generated for *res_b* which results in type confusion.<!----></span><br><br>## Exploitation<span class="line"><!---->## Exploitation<!----></span><br><br>Untagged WebAssembly global values are stored in a ArrayBuffer. The bounds check of accessing a global value is done in compile phase. As such, we can cause OOB access on partition heap by leveraging the type confusion bug and then achieves RCE.<span class="line"><!---->Untagged WebAssembly global values are stored in a ArrayBuffer. The bounds check of accessing a global value is done in compile phase. As such, we can cause OOB access on partition heap by leveraging the type confusion bug and then achieves RCE.<!----></span><br><br># Sandbox Escape<span class="line"><!----># Sandbox Escape<!----></span><br><br>## Details<span class="line"><!---->## Details<!----></span><br><br>|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<span class="line"><!---->|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<span class="line"><!---->int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<span class="line"><!---->  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host->GetFileSystemHost(); <-----<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host-&gt;GetFileSystemHost(); &lt;-----<!----></span><br>  open_flags_ = open_flags;<span class="line"><!---->  open_flags_ = open_flags;<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<span class="line"><!---->And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<span class="line"><!---->void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  found->second->SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<span class="line"><!---->  found-&gt;second-&gt;SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<!----></span><br>  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found->second); <--------<span class="line"><!---->  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found-&gt;second); &lt;--------<!----></span><br>  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<span class="line"><!---->  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<span class="line"><!---->This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_->GetFileSystemOperationRunner()->OpenFile(<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_-&gt;GetFileSystemOperationRunner()-&gt;OpenFile(<!----></span><br>      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<span class="line"><!---->      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>## Exploitation<span class="line"><!---->## Exploitation<!----></span><br><br>I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <span class="line"><!---->I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>    if (check_quota_)<span class="line"><!---->    if (check_quota_)<!----></span><br>      quota_file_system = file_system_host_->pp_resource();<span class="line"><!---->      quota_file_system = file_system_host_-&gt;pp_resource();<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<span class="line"><!---->After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<!----></span><br><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce<!----></a><br><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ppapi/host/ppapi_host.cc;l=262;drc=708fa822987d1b2146ce2659156a7713ac5e6810<a class="undefined"         I think the python webserver is a red herring, it's probably been included by accident. Here's how to make it work.<span class="line"><!---->I think the python webserver is a red herring, it's probably been included by accident. Here's how to make it work.<!----></span><br><br>1. Move chrome.zip from <span class="line"><!---->1. Move chrome.zip from <!----></span>#c3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c3"><!---->#c3<!----></a> into a redshell - <span class="line"><!----> into a redshell - <!----></span>https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hatrhi6V5_WogV7hIO2gSI5Uk8hHjdSAQeix4vTPt38/edit#<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hatrhi6V5_WogV7hIO2gSI5Uk8hHjdSAQeix4vTPt38/edit#"><!---->https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hatrhi6V5_WogV7hIO2gSI5Uk8hHjdSAQeix4vTPt38/edit#<!----></a><br>2. cd chrome/exp/ssl<span class="line"><!---->2. cd chrome/exp/ssl<!----></span><br>3. ln -s ../poc poc<span class="line"><!---->3. ln -s ../poc poc<!----></span><br>4. python3 server.py<span class="line"><!---->4. python3 server.py<!----></span><br>5. In Chrome visit <span class="line"><!---->5. In Chrome visit <!----></span>https://localhost:8001/poc/test.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost:8001/poc/test.html"><!---->https://localhost:8001/poc/test.html<!----></a><br>6. Nothing happens - because the GET method in server.py is not wired up. It looks like the whole of server.py is nonsense/irrelevant to me.<span class="line"><!---->6. Nothing happens - because the GET method in server.py is not wired up. It looks like the whole of server.py is nonsense/irrelevant to me.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        At the moment I'm giving up on the servers because the node server has syntax like "...wasmSignedLeb" which appears to be some kind of V8 intrinsic and I'm not sure how to enable such things with node command-line flags.<span class="line"><!---->At the moment I'm giving up on the servers because the node server has syntax like "...wasmSignedLeb" which appears to be some kind of V8 intrinsic and I'm not sure how to enable such things with node command-line flags.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

    <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>

         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

          position: relative;

          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;

          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>
      </label>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          Owner:<th><!---->Owner:</th>

              View details
            </button>
          </div>
        <div class="bottom-section-cell">
          <h3>BlockedOn:</h3>
            <div class="bottom-section-content">

          Comment 2<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146670#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146670#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146670#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Nov 6, 2020, 10:36 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>

        # Renderer Bug<span class="line"><!----># Renderer Bug<!----></span><br><br>## Details<span class="line"><!---->## Details<!----></span><br><br>When compiling large wasm code, chrome would serialize the compiled code as code cache and reuse it if the wasm resource is requested a second time. For now, WebAssembly caching is only implemented for the streaming API calls such as `compileStreaming`.<span class="line"><!---->When compiling large wasm code, chrome would serialize the compiled code as code cache and reuse it if the wasm resource is requested a second time. For now, WebAssembly caching is only implemented for the streaming API calls such as `compileStreaming`.<!----></span><br><br>However, the validation of wasm cache hit is insufficient. If attacker<span class="line"><!---->However, the validation of wasm cache hit is insufficient. If attacker<!----></span><br><br>1. Fetch a wasm resource (called *res_a*) from server without any cache control hint. and then<span class="line"><!---->1. Fetch a wasm resource (called *res_a*) from server without any cache control hint. and then<!----></span><br>2. Fetch a wasm resource with the same origin, but this time, the server will return a different resource file (called *res_b*) and tell chrome to cache it.<span class="line"><!---->2. Fetch a wasm resource with the same origin, but this time, the server will return a different resource file (called *res_b*) and tell chrome to cache it.<!----></span><br>3. Compile *res_a* , and chrome would reuse the code cache generated for *res_b* which results in type confusion.<span class="line"><!---->3. Compile *res_a* , and chrome would reuse the code cache generated for *res_b* which results in type confusion.<!----></span><br><br>## Exploitation<span class="line"><!---->## Exploitation<!----></span><br><br>Untagged WebAssembly global values are stored in a ArrayBuffer. The bounds check of accessing a global value is done in compile phase. As such, we can cause OOB access on partition heap by leveraging the type confusion bug and then achieves RCE.<span class="line"><!---->Untagged WebAssembly global values are stored in a ArrayBuffer. The bounds check of accessing a global value is done in compile phase. As such, we can cause OOB access on partition heap by leveraging the type confusion bug and then achieves RCE.<!----></span><br><br># Sandbox Escape<span class="line"><!----># Sandbox Escape<!----></span><br><br>## Details<span class="line"><!---->## Details<!----></span><br><br>|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<span class="line"><!---->|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<span class="line"><!---->int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<span class="line"><!---->  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host->GetFileSystemHost(); <-----<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host-&gt;GetFileSystemHost(); &lt;-----<!----></span><br>  open_flags_ = open_flags;<span class="line"><!---->  open_flags_ = open_flags;<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<span class="line"><!---->And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<span class="line"><!---->void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  found->second->SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<span class="line"><!---->  found-&gt;second-&gt;SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<!----></span><br>  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found->second); <--------<span class="line"><!---->  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found-&gt;second); &lt;--------<!----></span><br>  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<span class="line"><!---->  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<span class="line"><!---->This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_->GetFileSystemOperationRunner()->OpenFile(<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_-&gt;GetFileSystemOperationRunner()-&gt;OpenFile(<!----></span><br>      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<span class="line"><!---->      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>## Exploitation<span class="line"><!---->## Exploitation<!----></span><br><br>I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <span class="line"><!---->I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>    if (check_quota_)<span class="line"><!---->    if (check_quota_)<!----></span><br>      quota_file_system = file_system_host_->pp_resource();<span class="line"><!---->      quota_file_system = file_system_host_-&gt;pp_resource();<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<span class="line"><!---->After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<!----></span><br><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce<!----></a><br><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ppapi/host/ppapi_host.cc;l=262;drc=708fa822987d1b2146ce2659156a7713ac5e6810<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ppapi/host/ppapi_host.cc;l=262;drc=708fa822987d1b2146ce2659156a7713ac5e6810"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ppapi/host/ppapi_host.cc;l=262;drc=708fa822987d1b2146ce2659156a7713ac5e6810<!----></a><br><br>[3]         I think the python webserver is a red herring, it's probably been included by accident. Here's how to make it work.<span class="line"><!---->I think the python webserver is a red herring, it's probably been included by accident. Here's how to make it work.<!----></span><br><br>1. Move chrome.zip from <span class="line"><!---->1. Move chrome.zip from <!----></span>#c3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c3"><!---->#c3<!----></a> into a redshell - <span class="line"><!----> into a redshell - <!----></span>https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hatrhi6V5_WogV7hIO2gSI5Uk8hHjdSAQeix4vTPt38/edit#<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hatrhi6V5_WogV7hIO2gSI5Uk8hHjdSAQeix4vTPt38/edit#"><!---->https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hatrhi6V5_WogV7hIO2gSI5Uk8hHjdSAQeix4vTPt38/edit#<!----></a><br>2. cd chrome/exp/ssl<span class="line"><!---->2. cd chrome/exp/ssl<!----></span><br>3. ln -s ../poc poc<span class="line"><!---->3. ln -s ../poc poc<!----></span><br>4. python3 server.py<span class="line"><!---->4. python3 server.py<!----></span><br>5. In Chrome visit <span class="line"><!---->5. In Chrome visit <!----></span>https://localhost:8001/poc/test.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost:8001/poc/test.html"><!---->https://localhost:8001/poc/test.html<!----></a><br>6. Nothing happens - because the GET method in server.py is not wired up. It looks like the whole of server.py is nonsense/irrelevant to me.<span class="line"><!---->6. Nothing happens - because the GET method in server.py is not wired up. It looks like the whole of server.py is nonsense/irrelevant to me.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">

        Issue 1146679<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1146679" title="Security: WeakPtr checks are optimized out"><!---->Issue 1146679<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>broke this chain (we believe) by adding in CHECKs for the WeakPtr retrieval used in <span class="line"><!---->broke this chain (we believe) by adding in CHECKs for the WeakPtr retrieval used in <!----></span>issue 1146675<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1146675" title="Security: UAF in PepperFileIOHost"><!---->issue 1146675<!----></a>. That fix shipped today for desktop platforms. As such I am removing ReleaseBlock-Beta here.<span class="line"><!---->. That fix shipped today for desktop platforms. As such I am removing ReleaseBlock-Beta here.<!----></span><br><br>As this bug needs an owner, I'll assign it to me, but it's a tracking bug and I do not expect a fix to materaliize here - they will be in <span class="line"><!---->As this bug needs an owner, I'll assign it to me, but it's a tracking bug and I do not expect a fix to materaliize here - they will be in <!----></span>issues <span class="line"><!---->issues <!----></span>1146673<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1146673" title="Security: type confusion in wasm cache"><!---->1146673<!----></a> and <span class="line"><!----> and <!----></span>1146675<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1146675" title="Security: UAF in PepperFileIOHost"><!---->1146675<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        About the https server mentioned in <span class="line"><!---->About the https server mentioned in <!----></span>#c7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c7"><!---->#c7<!----></a>:<span class="line"><!---->:<!----></span><br>We occupy the freed object by using class SSLErrorHandler to do leak, so we should frequently visit this server to create the instance.<span class="line"><!---->We occupy the freed object by using class SSLErrorHandler to do leak, so we should frequently visit this server to create the instance.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 2<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146670#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      wfh@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/2196431582" title="wfh@chromium.org"><!---->wfh@chromium.org<!----></a>
      wfh@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->wfh@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

    <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Nov 6, 2020, 10:36 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146670#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Nov 6, 2020, 10:36 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146670#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Nov 6, 2020, 10:36 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        # Renderer Bug<span class="line"><!----># Renderer Bug<!----></span><br><br>## Details<span class="line"><!---->## Details<!----></span><br><br>When compiling large wasm code, chrome would serialize the compiled code as code cache and reuse it if the wasm resource is requested a second time. For now, WebAssembly caching is only implemented for the streaming API calls such as `compileStreaming`.<span class="line"><!---->When compiling large wasm code, chrome would serialize the compiled code as code cache and reuse it if the wasm resource is requested a second time. For now, WebAssembly caching is only implemented for the streaming API calls such as `compileStreaming`.<!----></span><br><br>However, the validation of wasm cache hit is insufficient. If attacker<span class="line"><!---->However, the validation of wasm cache hit is insufficient. If attacker<!----></span><br><br>1. Fetch a wasm resource (called *res_a*) from server without any cache control hint. and then<span class="line"><!---->1. Fetch a wasm resource (called *res_a*) from server without any cache control hint. and then<!----></span><br>2. Fetch a wasm resource with the same origin, but this time, the server will return a different resource file (called *res_b*) and tell chrome to cache it.<span class="line"><!---->2. Fetch a wasm resource with the same origin, but this time, the server will return a different resource file (called *res_b*) and tell chrome to cache it.<!----></span><br>3. Compile *res_a* , and chrome would reuse the code cache generated for *res_b* which results in type confusion.<span class="line"><!---->3. Compile *res_a* , and chrome would reuse the code cache generated for *res_b* which results in type confusion.<!----></span><br><br>## Exploitation<span class="line"><!---->## Exploitation<!----></span><br><br>Untagged WebAssembly global values are stored in a ArrayBuffer. The bounds check of accessing a global value is done in compile phase. As such, we can cause OOB access on partition heap by leveraging the type confusion bug and then achieves RCE.<span class="line"><!---->Untagged WebAssembly global values are stored in a ArrayBuffer. The bounds check of accessing a global value is done in compile phase. As such, we can cause OOB access on partition heap by leveraging the type confusion bug and then achieves RCE.<!----></span><br><br># Sandbox Escape<span class="line"><!----># Sandbox Escape<!----></span><br><br>## Details<span class="line"><!---->## Details<!----></span><br><br>|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<span class="line"><!---->|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<span class="line"><!---->int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<span class="line"><!---->  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host->GetFileSystemHost(); <-----<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host-&gt;GetFileSystemHost(); &lt;-----<!----></span><br>  open_flags_ = open_flags;<span class="line"><!---->  open_flags_ = open_flags;<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<span class="line"><!---->And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<span class="line"><!---->void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  found->second->SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<span class="line"><!---->  found-&gt;second-&gt;SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<!----></span><br>  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found->second); <--------<span class="line"><!---->  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found-&gt;second); &lt;--------<!----></span><br>  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<span class="line"><!---->  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<span class="line"><!---->This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_->GetFileSystemOperationRunner()->OpenFile(<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_-&gt;GetFileSystemOperationRunner()-&gt;OpenFile(<!----></span><br>      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<span class="line"><!---->      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>## Exploitation<span class="line"><!---->## Exploitation<!----></span><br><br>I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <span class="line"><!---->I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>    if (check_quota_)<span class="line"><!---->    if (check_quota_)<!----></span><br>      quota_file_system = file_system_host_->pp_resource();<span class="line"><!---->      quota_file_system = file_system_host_-&gt;pp_resource();<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<span class="line"><!---->After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<!----></span><br><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce<!----></a><br><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ppapi/host/ppapi_host.cc;l=262;drc=708fa822987d1b2146ce2659156a7713ac5e6810<a class="undefined" target="_blank"           Comment 3<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146670#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

        I think the python webserver is a red herring, it's probably been included by accident. Here's how to make it work.<span class="line"><!---->I think the python webserver is a red herring, it's probably been included by accident. Here's how to make it work.<!----></span><br><br>1. Move chrome.zip from <span class="line"><!---->1. Move chrome.zip from <!----></span>#c3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c3"><!---->#c3<!----></a> into a redshell - <span class="line"><!----> into a redshell - <!----></span>https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hatrhi6V5_WogV7hIO2gSI5Uk8hHjdSAQeix4vTPt38/edit#<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hatrhi6V5_WogV7hIO2gSI5Uk8hHjdSAQeix4vTPt38/edit#"><!---->https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hatrhi6V5_WogV7hIO2gSI5Uk8hHjdSAQeix4vTPt38/edit#<!----></a><br>2. cd chrome/exp/ssl<span class="line"><!---->2. cd chrome/exp/ssl<!----></span><br>3. ln -s ../poc poc<span class="line"><!---->3. ln -s ../poc poc<!----></span><br>4. python3 server.py<span class="line"><!---->4. python3 server.py<!----></span><br>5. In Chrome visit <span class="line"><!---->5. In Chrome visit <!----></span>https://localhost:8001/poc/test.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost:8001/poc/test.html"><!---->https://localhost:8001/poc/test.html<!----></a><br>6. Nothing happens - because the GET method in server.py is not wired up. It looks like the whole of server.py is nonsense/irrelevant to me.<span class="line"><!---->6. Nothing happens - because the GET method in server.py is not wired up. It looks like the whole of server.py is nonsense/irrelevant to me.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        At the moment I'm giving up on the servers because the node server has syntax like "...wasmSignedLeb" which appears to be some kind of V8 intrinsic and I'm not sure how to enable such things with node command-line flags.<span class="line"><!---->At the moment I'm giving up on the servers because the node server has syntax like "...wasmSignedLeb" which appears to be some kind of V8 intrinsic and I'm not sure how to enable such things with node command-line flags.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

      </i>
      
    <mr-restriction-indicator hidden=""></mr-restriction-indicator>

          Comment 2<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146670#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146670#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        # Renderer Bug<span class="line"><!----># Renderer Bug<!----></span><br><br>## Details<span class="line"><!---->## Details<!----></span><br><br>When compiling large wasm code, chrome would serialize the compiled code as code cache and reuse it if the wasm resource is requested a second time. For now, WebAssembly caching is only implemented for the streaming API calls such as `compileStreaming`.<span class="line"><!---->When compiling large wasm code, chrome would serialize the compiled code as code cache and reuse it if the wasm resource is requested a second time. For now, WebAssembly caching is only implemented for the streaming API calls such as `compileStreaming`.<!----></span><br><br>However, the validation of wasm cache hit is insufficient. If attacker<span class="line"><!---->However, the validation of wasm cache hit is insufficient. If attacker<!----></span><br><br>1. Fetch a wasm resource (called *res_a*) from server without any cache control hint. and then<span class="line"><!---->1. Fetch a wasm resource (called *res_a*) from server without any cache control hint. and then<!----></span><br>2. Fetch a wasm resource with the same origin, but this time, the server will return a different resource file (called *res_b*) and tell chrome to cache it.<span class="line"><!---->2. Fetch a wasm resource with the same origin, but this time, the server will return a different resource file (called *res_b*) and tell chrome to cache it.<!----></span><br>3. Compile *res_a* , and chrome would reuse the code cache generated for *res_b* which results in type confusion.<span class="line"><!---->3. Compile *res_a* , and chrome would reuse the code cache generated for *res_b* which results in type confusion.<!----></span><br><br>## Exploitation<span class="line"><!---->## Exploitation<!----></span><br><br>Untagged WebAssembly global values are stored in a ArrayBuffer. The bounds check of accessing a global value is done in compile phase. As such, we can cause OOB access on partition heap by leveraging the type confusion bug and then achieves RCE.<span class="line"><!---->Untagged WebAssembly global values are stored in a ArrayBuffer. The bounds check of accessing a global value is done in compile phase. As such, we can cause OOB access on partition heap by leveraging the type confusion bug and then achieves RCE.<!----></span><br><br># Sandbox Escape<span class="line"><!----># Sandbox Escape<!----></span><br><br>## Details<span class="line"><!---->## Details<!----></span><br><br>|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<span class="line"><!---->|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<span class="line"><!---->int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<span class="line"><!---->  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host->GetFileSystemHost(); <-----<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host-&gt;GetFileSystemHost(); &lt;-----<!----></span><br>  open_flags_ = open_flags;<span class="line"><!---->  open_flags_ = open_flags;<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<span class="line"><!---->And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<span class="line"><!---->void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  found->second->SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<span class="line"><!---->  found-&gt;second-&gt;SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<!----></span><br>  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found->second); <--------<span class="line"><!---->  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found-&gt;second); &lt;--------<!----></span><br>  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<span class="line"><!---->  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<span class="line"><!---->This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_->GetFileSystemOperationRunner()->OpenFile(<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_-&gt;GetFileSystemOperationRunner()-&gt;OpenFile(<!----></span><br>      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<span class="line"><!---->      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>## Exploitation<span class="line"><!---->## Exploitation<!----></span><br><br>I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <span class="line"><!---->I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>    if (check_quota_)<span class="line"><!---->    if (check_quota_)<!----></span><br>      quota_file_system = file_system_host_->pp_resource();<span class="line"><!---->      quota_file_system = file_system_host_-&gt;pp_resource();<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<span class="line"><!---->After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<!----></span><br><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce<!----></a><br><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ppapi/host/ppapi_host.cc;l=262;drc=708fa822987d1b2146ce2659156a7713ac5e6810<a class="undefined"         I think the python webserver is a red herring, it's probably been included by accident. Here's how to make it work.<span class="line"><!---->I think the python webserver is a red herring, it's probably been included by accident. Here's how to make it work.<!----></span><br><br>1. Move chrome.zip from <span class="line"><!---->1. Move chrome.zip from <!----></span>#c3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c3"><!---->#c3<!----></a> into a redshell - <span class="line"><!----> into a redshell - <!----></span>https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hatrhi6V5_WogV7hIO2gSI5Uk8hHjdSAQeix4vTPt38/edit#<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hatrhi6V5_WogV7hIO2gSI5Uk8hHjdSAQeix4vTPt38/edit#"><!---->https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hatrhi6V5_WogV7hIO2gSI5Uk8hHjdSAQeix4vTPt38/edit#<!----></a><br>2. cd chrome/exp/ssl<span class="line"><!---->2. cd chrome/exp/ssl<!----></span><br>3. ln -s ../poc poc<span class="line"><!---->3. ln -s ../poc poc<!----></span><br>4. python3 server.py<span class="line"><!---->4. python3 server.py<!----></span><br>5. In Chrome visit <span class="line"><!---->5. In Chrome visit <!----></span>https://localhost:8001/poc/test.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost:8001/poc/test.html"><!---->https://localhost:8001/poc/test.html<!----></a><br>6. Nothing happens - because the GET method in server.py is not wired up. It looks like the whole of server.py is nonsense/irrelevant to me.<span class="line"><!---->6. Nothing happens - because the GET method in server.py is not wired up. It looks like the whole of server.py is nonsense/irrelevant to me.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 2<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146670#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      wfh@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/2196431582" title="wfh@chromium.org"><!---->wfh@chromium.org<!----></a>
      wfh@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->wfh@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Fri, Nov 6, 2020, 10:36 PM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Nov 6, 2020, 10:36 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146670#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Nov 6, 2020, 10:36 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146670#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Nov 6, 2020, 10:36 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        # Renderer Bug<span class="line"><!----># Renderer Bug<!----></span><br><br>## Details<span class="line"><!---->## Details<!----></span><br><br>When compiling large wasm code, chrome would serialize the compiled code as code cache and reuse it if the wasm resource is requested a second time. For now, WebAssembly caching is only implemented for the streaming API calls such as `compileStreaming`.<span class="line"><!---->When compiling large wasm code, chrome would serialize the compiled code as code cache and reuse it if the wasm resource is requested a second time. For now, WebAssembly caching is only implemented for the streaming API calls such as `compileStreaming`.<!----></span><br><br>However, the validation of wasm cache hit is insufficient. If attacker<span class="line"><!---->However, the validation of wasm cache hit is insufficient. If attacker<!----></span><br><br>1. Fetch a wasm resource (called *res_a*) from server without any cache control hint. and then<span class="line"><!---->1. Fetch a wasm resource (called *res_a*) from server without any cache control hint. and then<!----></span><br>2. Fetch a wasm resource with the same origin, but this time, the server will return a different resource file (called *res_b*) and tell chrome to cache it.<span class="line"><!---->2. Fetch a wasm resource with the same origin, but this time, the server will return a different resource file (called *res_b*) and tell chrome to cache it.<!----></span><br>3. Compile *res_a* , and chrome would reuse the code cache generated for *res_b* which results in type confusion.<span class="line"><!---->3. Compile *res_a* , and chrome would reuse the code cache generated for *res_b* which results in type confusion.<!----></span><br><br>## Exploitation<span class="line"><!---->## Exploitation<!----></span><br><br>Untagged WebAssembly global values are stored in a ArrayBuffer. The bounds check of accessing a global value is done in compile phase. As such, we can cause OOB access on partition heap by leveraging the type confusion bug and then achieves RCE.<span class="line"><!---->Untagged WebAssembly global values are stored in a ArrayBuffer. The bounds check of accessing a global value is done in compile phase. As such, we can cause OOB access on partition heap by leveraging the type confusion bug and then achieves RCE.<!----></span><br><br># Sandbox Escape<span class="line"><!----># Sandbox Escape<!----></span><br><br>## Details<span class="line"><!---->## Details<!----></span><br><br>|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<span class="line"><!---->|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<span class="line"><!---->int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<span class="line"><!---->  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host->GetFileSystemHost(); <-----<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host-&gt;GetFileSystemHost(); &lt;-----<!----></span><br>  open_flags_ = open_flags;<span class="line"><!---->  open_flags_ = open_flags;<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<span class="line"><!---->And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<span class="line"><!---->void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  found->second->SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<span class="line"><!---->  found-&gt;second-&gt;SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<!----></span><br>  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found->second); <--------<span class="line"><!---->  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found-&gt;second); &lt;--------<!----></span><br>  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<span class="line"><!---->  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<span class="line"><!---->This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_->GetFileSystemOperationRunner()->OpenFile(<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_-&gt;GetFileSystemOperationRunner()-&gt;OpenFile(<!----></span><br>      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<span class="line"><!---->      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>## Exploitation<span class="line"><!---->## Exploitation<!----></span><br><br>I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <span class="line"><!---->I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>    if (check_quota_)<span class="line"><!---->    if (check_quota_)<!----></span><br>      quota_file_system = file_system_host_->pp_resource();<span class="line"><!---->      quota_file_system = file_system_host_-&gt;pp_resource();<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<span class="line"><!---->After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<!----></span><br><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce<!----></a><br><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ppapi/host/ppapi_host.cc;l=262;drc=708fa822987d1b2146ce2659156a7713ac5e6810<a class="undefined"         by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        I think the python webserver is a red herring, it's probably been included by accident. Here's how to make it work.<span class="line"><!---->I think the python webserver is a red herring, it's probably been included by accident. Here's how to make it work.<!----></span><br><br>1. Move chrome.zip from <span class="line"><!---->1. Move chrome.zip from <!----></span>#c3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c3"><!---->#c3<!----></a> into a redshell - <span class="line"><!----> into a redshell - <!----></span>https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hatrhi6V5_WogV7hIO2gSI5Uk8hHjdSAQeix4vTPt38/edit#<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hatrhi6V5_WogV7hIO2gSI5Uk8hHjdSAQeix4vTPt38/edit#"><!---->https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hatrhi6V5_WogV7hIO2gSI5Uk8hHjdSAQeix4vTPt38/edit#<!----></a><br>2. cd chrome/exp/ssl<span class="line"><!---->2. cd chrome/exp/ssl<!----></span><br>3. ln -s ../poc poc<span class="line"><!---->3. ln -s ../poc poc<!----></span><br>4. python3 server.py<span class="line"><!---->4. python3 server.py<!----></span><br>5. In Chrome visit <span class="line"><!---->5. In Chrome visit <!----></span>https://localhost:8001/poc/test.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost:8001/poc/test.html"><!---->https://localhost:8001/poc/test.html<!----></a><br>6. Nothing happens - because the GET method in server.py is not wired up. It looks like the whole of server.py is nonsense/irrelevant to me.<span class="line"><!---->6. Nothing happens - because the GET method in server.py is not wired up. It looks like the whole of server.py is nonsense/irrelevant to me.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
