        Issue 1146679<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1146679" title="Security: WeakPtr checks are optimized out"><!---->Issue 1146679<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>broke this chain (we believe) by adding in CHECKs for the WeakPtr retrieval used in <span class="line"><!---->broke this chain (we believe) by adding in CHECKs for the WeakPtr retrieval used in <!----></span>issue 1146675<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1146675" title="Security: UAF in PepperFileIOHost"><!---->issue 1146675<!----></a>. That fix shipped today for desktop platforms. As such I am removing ReleaseBlock-Beta here.<span class="line"><!---->. That fix shipped today for desktop platforms. As such I am removing ReleaseBlock-Beta here.<!----></span><br><br>As this bug needs an owner, I'll assign it to me, but it's a tracking bug and I do not expect a fix to materaliize here - they will be in <span class="line"><!---->As this bug needs an owner, I'll assign it to me, but it's a tracking bug and I do not expect a fix to materaliize here - they will be in <!----></span>issues <span class="line"><!---->issues <!----></span>1146673<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1146673" title="Security: type confusion in wasm cache"><!---->1146673<!----></a> and <span class="line"><!----> and <!----></span>1146675<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1146675" title="Security: UAF in PepperFileIOHost"><!---->1146675<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This is a critical security issue. If you are not able to fix this quickly, please revert the change that introduced it.<span class="line"><!---->This is a critical security issue. If you are not able to fix this quickly, please revert the change that introduced it.<!----></span><br><br>If this doesn't affect a release branch, or has not been properly classified for severity, please update the Security_Impact or Security_Severity labels, and remove the ReleaseBlock label. To disable this altogether, apply ReleaseBlock-NA.<span class="line"><!---->If this doesn't affect a release branch, or has not been properly classified for severity, please update the Security_Impact or Security_Severity labels, and remove the ReleaseBlock label. To disable this altogether, apply ReleaseBlock-NA.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2.         <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Nov 6, 2020, 10:36 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        # Renderer Bug<span class="line"><!----># Renderer Bug<!----></span><br><br>## Details<span class="line"><!---->## Details<!----></span><br><br>When compiling large wasm code, chrome would serialize the compiled code as code cache and reuse it if the wasm resource is requested a second time. For now, WebAssembly caching is only implemented for the streaming API calls such as `compileStreaming`.<span class="line"><!---->When compiling large wasm code, chrome would serialize the compiled code as code cache and reuse it if the wasm resource is requested a second time. For now, WebAssembly caching is only implemented for the streaming API calls such as `compileStreaming`.<!----></span><br><br>However, the validation of wasm cache hit is insufficient. If attacker<span class="line"><!---->However, the validation of wasm cache hit is insufficient. If attacker<!----></span><br><br>1. Fetch a wasm resource (called *res_a*) from server without any cache control hint. and then<span class="line"><!---->1. Fetch a wasm resource (called *res_a*) from server without any cache control hint. and then<!----></span><br>2. Fetch a wasm resource with the same origin, but this time, the server will return a different resource file (called *res_b*) and tell chrome to cache it.<span class="line"><!---->2. Fetch a wasm resource with the same origin, but this time, the server will return a different resource file (called *res_b*) and tell chrome to cache it.<!----></span><br>3. Compile *res_a* , and chrome would reuse the code cache generated for *res_b* which results in type confusion.<span class="line"><!---->3. Compile *res_a* , and chrome would reuse the code cache generated for *res_b* which results in type confusion.<!----></span><br><br>## Exploitation<span class="line"><!---->## Exploitation<!----></span><br><br>Untagged WebAssembly global values are stored in a ArrayBuffer. The bounds check of accessing a global value is done in compile phase. As such, we can cause OOB access on partition heap by leveraging the type confusion bug and then achieves RCE.<span class="line"><!---->Untagged WebAssembly global values are stored in a ArrayBuffer. The bounds check of accessing a global value is done in compile phase. As such, we can cause OOB access on partition heap by leveraging the type confusion bug and then achieves RCE.<!----></span><br><br># Sandbox Escape<span class="line"><!----># Sandbox Escape<!----></span><br><br>## Details<span class="line"><!---->## Details<!----></span><br><br>|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<span class="line"><!---->|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<span class="line"><!---->int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<span class="line"><!---->  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host->GetFileSystemHost(); <-----<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host-&gt;GetFileSystemHost(); &lt;-----<!----></span><br>  open_flags_ = open_flags;<span class="line"><!---->  open_flags_ = open_flags;<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<span class="line"><!---->And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<span class="line"><!---->void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  found->second->SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<span class="line"><!---->  found-&gt;second-&gt;SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<!----></span><br>  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found->second); <--------<span class="line"><!---->  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found-&gt;second); &lt;--------<!----></span><br>  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<span class="line"><!---->  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<span class="line"><!---->This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_->GetFileSystemOperationRunner()->OpenFile(<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_-&gt;GetFileSystemOperationRunner()-&gt;OpenFile(<!----></span><br>      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<span class="line"><!---->      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>## Exploitation<span class="line"><!---->## Exploitation<!----></span><br><br>I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <span class="line"><!---->I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>    if (check_quota_)<span class="line"><!---->    if (check_quota_)<!----></span><br>      quota_file_system = file_system_host_->pp_resource();<span class="line"><!---->      quota_file_system = file_system_host_-&gt;pp_resource();<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<span class="line"><!---->After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<!----></span><br><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce<!----></a><br><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ppapi/host/ppapi_host.cc;l=262;drc=708fa822987d1b2146ce2659156a7713ac5e6810<a class="undefined"         I think the python webserver is a red herring, it's probably been included by accident. Here's how to make it work.<span class="line"><!---->I think the python webserver is a red herring, it's probably been included by accident. Here's how to make it work.<!----></span><br><br>1. Move chrome.zip from <span class="line"><!---->1. Move chrome.zip from <!----></span>#c3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c3"><!---->#c3<!----></a> into a redshell - <span class="line"><!----> into a redshell - <!----></span>https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hatrhi6V5_WogV7hIO2gSI5Uk8hHjdSAQeix4vTPt38/edit#<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hatrhi6V5_WogV7hIO2gSI5Uk8hHjdSAQeix4vTPt38/edit#"><!---->https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hatrhi6V5_WogV7hIO2gSI5Uk8hHjdSAQeix4vTPt38/edit#<!----></a><br>2. cd chrome/exp/ssl<span class="line"><!---->2. cd chrome/exp/ssl<!----></span><br>3. ln -s ../poc poc<span class="line"><!---->3. ln -s ../poc poc<!----></span><br>4. python3 server.py<span class="line"><!---->4. python3 server.py<!----></span><br>5. Nothing happens - because the GET method in server.py is not wired up. It looks like the whole of server.py is nonsense/irrelevant to me.<span class="line"><!---->6.         This is sufficiently serious that it should be merged to stable. But I can't see a Chromium repo commit here, so you will need to investigate what - if anything - needs to be merged to M86. Is there a fix in some other repo which should be merged? Or, perhaps this ticket is a duplicate of some other ticket which has the real fix: please track that down and ensure it is merged appropriately.<span class="line"><!---->This is sufficiently serious that it should be merged to stable. But I can't see a Chromium repo commit here, so you will need to investigate what - if anything - needs to be merged to M86. Is there a fix in some other repo which should be merged? Or, perhaps this ticket is a duplicate of some other ticket which has the real fix: please track that down and ensure it is merged appropriately.<!----></span><br><br>This is sufficiently serious that it should be merged to beta. But I can't see a Chromium repo commit here, so you will need to investigate what - if anything - needs to be merged to M87. Is there a fix in some other repo which should be merged? Or, perhaps this ticket is a duplicate of some other ticket which has the real fix: please track that down and ensure it is merged appropriately.<span class="line"><!---->This is sufficiently serious that it should be merged to beta. But I can't see a Chromium repo commit here, so you will need to investigate what - if anything - needs to be merged to M87. Is there a fix in some other repo which should be merged? Or, perhaps this ticket is a duplicate of some other ticket which has the real fix: please track that down and ensure it is merged appropriately.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4.               <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
